content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Stone Furnace Smelting Setup at position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at (41.0, -82.0) processing ores.
• Burner Inserter at (41.5, -83.5) transferring furnace output.
• Wooden Chest at (41.5, -84.5) storing processed items.
• Wooden Chest at (42.5, -81.5) serving as additional storage.

### Lab Setup at position (~45.5, -79.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (various electrical IDs over time; latest at 207) at its designated position receiving automation science packs for research.

### Boiler and Steam Engine Production Setup
Consists of:
• Boiler originally at (42.5, -79.0) now repositioned to (-21.0, 26.5) near the Offshore Pump. The repositioned boiler has been picked up and placed with connection points now at (-20.5, 24.5) and (-20.5, 28.5), with its steam output at (-23.0, 26.5). It shows warnings such as “no input liquid” though it received wood fuel in a later step.
• Steam Engine (Generator) at (48.5, -75.5) with its connection points at (48.5, -78.0) and (48.5, -73.0) continues to be disconnected from power and displays warnings (not receiving electricity, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections).

### Offshore Pump Water Supply Setup
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (–17.5, 26.5) operating with a connection point at (–17.5, 25.5) and providing water.
• Multiple PipeGroups linking the offshore pump to the boiler system. The latest pipe group of interest is at position (–16.5, 25.5) (FULL_OUTPUT) with others nearby designated by their fluid system IDs.

### Electricity Pole Network
Consists of:
• Multiple Small Electric Poles (positions around the lab and generator) interconnected in an ElectricityGroup (latest ID 207) linking poles at positions such as (48.5, –79.5), (46.5, –75.5), and (48.5, –80.5).

ERROR TIPS
• Connection Failures for Water Supply – Several attempts to connect the Offshore Pump to the Boiler have failed due to missing required items. Verify inventory and ensure that the correct connecting item (pipe) is picked up before attempting the connection.
• Incorrect Prototype Usage in Pickup – An error occurred when using a construction prototype (StoneFurnace) instead of a proper Position object. Ensure that all tool or method arguments correctly supply Position objects rather than prototypes.
• Boiler Placement Obstructions – Multiple boiler placement errors arose due to collisions with existing entities or unsuitable terrain (e.g., water areas). Increase spacing or alter direction/reference positions to avoid collisions with entities such as offshore pumps or water blocks.
• Repeated Connection Attempt Handling – Repeated reconnection errors suggest reviewing the inventory requirements and ensuring that connection items are refilled or available prior to attempting reconnection procedures.
